characters/nydid.html.title: Nydid
characters/nydid.html.description:
Home | Player Character List
Infobox Iron Gut ðŸŸ© No Nydid is known for being a Cook, Brewer, Mushroom FarmerThey specialize in Stews/Mushrooms/AlcoholFormer Spifftopian Templar, now runs a stew shop in a quest to explore the culinary arts
In search of a new beginning, Nydid arrived at the gates of Spifftopia, left in a state where power was shifting rapidly, and those without connections found themselves lost in the chaos. Penniless and weary from his long journey, Nydid sought refuge in the one place that still offered sanctuary to the downtrodden: the local church of Godking Spiff.Here, Nydid heard the sermons of the Church's priestess, preaching the divine rule of Godking Spiff, the god who, according to legend, had blessed the lands of Spifftopia with prosperity. Captivated by the teachings and desperate for purpose, Nydid found solace in the faith of the Godking.After the sermons, Nydid remained, offering his services to the church in exchange for food and shelter. What began as simple labor soon became an integral role in the daily operations of the church. He helped maintain the church grounds, assisted in organizing the donations, and tended to the flock of believers that streamed through the temple doors.
It was during this time that he met Davelore, a fellow refugee of sorts, who had also come seeking purpose within the walls of the church. Together, the two worked tirelessly to support the church as its influence spread across Spifftopia. Their loyalty did not go unnoticed.As the Church grew in power, more people flocked to its cause, and soon, the voice of Godking Spiff echoed far beyond the city. The Church became a central power in Spifftopiaâ€™s political landscape, often mediating disputes and consolidating its influence over the common folk and nobles alike.
Nydid and Daveloreâ€™s dedication was rewarded when they were both inducted into the Templar Order, the militant arm of the Church. Clad in the sacred armor of the templars and wielding weapons blessed in the name of Godking Spiff, Nydid swore an oath to protect the faith and enforce the Churchâ€™s laws. His duty was clear: to defend the Church from its enemies, both internal and external.
While Davelore quickly ascended the ranks, eventually becoming Templar Grandmaster, Nydid took a more humble path. Though a skilled fighter, he found a deeper calling in ensuring that the Churchâ€™s ranks were well-fed and supplied during the times of famine. His contributions were not on the battlefield but in the kitchens, where he transformed meager rations into meals that kept the Church's forces strong.However, as the years passed, Nydid began to notice cracks in the foundation of the Church he had sworn to serve. Corruption, greed, and a thirst for political power seemed to infect the upper ranks of the clergy. Once a humble institution dedicated to the worship of Godking Spiff, the Church had become a political machine, prioritizing its own gain over the well-being of the people it claimed to protect.Nydidâ€™s disillusionment grew as he witnessed the suffering of the common folk, ignored by a Church more focused on expanding its wealth and influence. He spoke out, urging the Church leaders to return to their true purpose: serving the people in the name of Godking Spiff. But instead of listening, they silenced him.Branded a traitor to the Church, Nydid was stripped of his rank and exiled to a distant island, far from Spifftopia. Though the exile was presented as an act of mercy, it was clear to Nydid that it was meant to be his end. Banished from the only life he had known, he was left with nothing but his skills and his faithâ€”though even that was shaken.The island was a harsh and desolate place, inhabited only by a few fellow exiles. Despite the isolation, Nydid found a sense of peace in the simplicity of his new life. He no longer had to navigate the treacherous politics of Spifftopia, and for the first time in years, he was free to live without fear of betrayal.Nydid did not take on any formal roles in the small exile community. Instead, he helped wherever he could, offering his strength and skills as needed. Often, he would join expeditions into the wild, venturing into untamed lands in search of resources.Mining for the town became one of his primary contributions. He spent hours in the dark caverns beneath the island, searching for precious minerals and materials that could help the community survive. Though the work was grueling, it gave him a sense of purpose and helped him distance himself from the political scheming of his past.But Nydidâ€™s greatest contribution came not from the forge or the fields, but from the kitchen. Drawing on the skills he had honed during the Spifftopian Famines, Nydid began cooking for the community. What started as simple meals soon became a source of pride for him.He set up a small stew shop in the inner ward, where he provided nourishing meals to the townsfolk. As he stirred the bubbling pots, Nydid found a new sense of purposeâ€”not in battle or in service to a corrupt institution, but in the simple act of feeding those in need.

databases/npc-database.html.title: NPC Database
databases/npc-database.html.description: File*AllegianceSkillsStateSummaryLore1AlenfarAmidonian TemplarsUnknownDeceasedTemplar LeaderHigh Templar on the Dark Isles, Alenfar oversees a wide ranging extraction operation on the Dark Isles, which has included the import of many convict labourers, including many colonists. This has made him unpopular with the Spifftopians, although his relationship with our town remains on generally amicable terms.2Ashley SpiritNoneHunger AoEUnknownHungry Spirit3Betty BloodNoneUnknownAliveDemon4ByronArchaeology DepartmentUnknownAliveArchaeologist5CharlesCitizensUnknownAlive6CreinGuardsUnknownAliveEx-slave7EleonCultistsUltra SpeedUnknownTest Subject8ErineCultistsUnknownDeceasedGrunt9CunienMerchantsUnknownDeceasedCommon visitor The regular trader to the settlement, Cunien is a 10FalandarCultistsUnknownAlivePowerful SpritA spirit so massive and powerful that we do not fully understand its proportions.11FashleyNoneUnknownAliveDemon12Father StefanCultistsUnknownDeceasedGrunt13GaryNoneUnknownUnknownDemon14GutankrtAmidonian InquisitionUnknownAliveGrand InquisitorOne of two Grand inqusitors on the Dark Isles, Gutankrt is supernaturally strong. Generally considered offputting by the colonists, they nevertheless appear to have assisted the colony by using a considerable number of lapis blocks to seal the entrance to falandar proper. Resides in the inquisition's snowy outpost, where they delight in torture and stabbing visitors with a weird stick15GeriloEscapeesUnknownDeceasedWriter Gerilio recorded the events leading up to the destruction of voyager's end, and the process that led to Marcus establishing Falandar's Cult16HalthawnGuardsUnknownAliveCarl's Loyalest Soldier17HelenCastle StaffUnknownUnknownMaidSubject to "Amidonian Conditioning", Helen has effectively had her free will stripped and will follow orders unquestioningly. She was bought from the Merchants by Carl, and was subsequently gifted to the Governor. How she arrived on the Isles as a slave is unknown.18HalcawFolbfolkUnknownAliveChief19LardenAmidonian TemplarsUnknownDeceasedScoutTemplar Scout, and frequent companion of Alenfar, Larden is perceptive and generally no-nonsense.20LeatanFolbfolkUnknownAliveHippie21ImbellaFolbfolkUnknownAliveHippie22JakelEscapeesUnknownDeceased23LiamArchaeology DepartmentSquilkingAliveRookie Explorer24MarcusCultistsUnknownAliveCult Leader25MatthewAmidonian TemplarsUnknownUnknownGrunt26Nate AsherCastle StaffUnknownUnknownSecretaryLongtime friend of the Governor, Nate is a competent secretary with a penchant for bad joke and worse fiction.27MuseNoneUnknownAliveSpirit28Old Man HaroldArchaeology DepartmentUnknownAliveArchivist29PeleNoneUnknownAliveVolcano Spirit30SanderkMerchantsUnknownDeceasedTrader31SeaserpaMerchantsUnknownDeceasedLeaderShrewd and dangerous, Seaserpa leads a freeport from which trader capable of running the blockade trade valuable outside goods32SeastikAlcoholUnknownAliveDrunkardEx pirate captain who has racked up massive debts to unreputable lenders. He is best known for his drinking problems, his hatred of anyone who gets inbetween him and destroying his liver further, taking the first set of player characters to the island, and drinking. Dislikes authority, especially the Governor, who evicted him from his original shack33SmithNoneMagicAliveWizard34TheockanAmidonian InquisitionUnknownAliveGrand InquisitorThe other Grand Inquisitor, an absolute unit by any normal measurememt except when standing next to Gutankrt. Is generally more sane than his comrade, although he acts more as a subordinate to Gutankrt than an equal, at least in public35ZoodGuardsUnknownAliveDrunkard36MulkiasAmidonian TemplarsShoutingAliveGrunt?37Jason the MasonJasonryMasonryAliveMason Jason Jasonson, son of Jason Jasonson, grew up in the slums of Spifftopia, where he decided, like his father, and his father before him, and his father aswell, to become a Masonman. One day, when Jason returned back to his father's Masonry Workshop, he realized that his brother, Dason Jasonson, had done a Masonry coup against his father, and due to the power this granted him, had decided to banish Jason Jasonson from Spifftopia, and sent him with the next colony ship to the Dark Isles. Now, on the Dark Isles, Jason Jasonson has setup his own Masonry Workshop, the Jasonry, where he secretly plots his revenge upon his brother.38PonkAlive+1

misc/changelog.html.title: Changelog
misc/changelog.html.description:
- Removed descriptions from Character Canvas
- Merged Google Sheets Columns "Description" and "Other"
- Modified the Dataview.css to fix a display issue

misc/project-kanban.html.title: Project Kanban
misc/project-kanban.html.description:
Ideas4Spifftopian Calendar ConverterPython - Safety Features Backups: Create a backup of markdown files before modifying them. Validation: Check Google Sheets data for inconsistencies before overwriting. Dry Run Mode: Preview changes before applying them. Atomic Changes: Ensure changes are rolled back if errors occur.
Logging: Keep a log of all changes made. Templates - Functionality Improvements
Template Versioning: Track template versions and update accordingly. Add a Library Page - With summaries of all books+ Add a cardTo Do4Skin the DMsRedo the Index pagePlayer Structures Canvas - Outline change on built typeElder Wilds Slander Page+ Add a cardDoing10Add better column data handling - Player Wiki Descriptions - Rename Descriptions to summary, add other column for extra data, auto populate after thatImplement Character DeathsCategorize NPC List by AllegianceTEMPLATE - CharacterTEMPLATE - Player StructureTEMPLATE - NPCTEMPLATE - Character WikiGather NPC SkinsGather Player Structure ScreenshotsAlliegiance List - To Do+ Add a cardCompleted7Remove Description from Character CanvasCategorize PC List by Alive/DeadGather Player SkinsFix Icon Shortcodes ScalingGoogle Sheets Sync - gspread - pyamlWikipedia SidepanelTimeline+ Add a card

His contributions were not on the battlefield but in the kitchens, where he transformed meager rations into meals that kept the Church's forces strong.However, as the years passed, Nydid began to notice cracks in the foundation of the Church he had sworn to serve. Corruption, greed, and a thirst for political power seemed to infect the upper ranks of the clergy. Once a humble institution dedicated to the worship of Godking Spiff, the Church had become a political machine, prioritizing its own gain over the well-being of the people it claimed to protect.Nydidâ€™s disillusionment grew as he witnessed the suffering of the common folk, ignored by a Church more focused on expanding its wealth and influence. He spoke out, urging the Church leaders to return to their true purpose: serving the people in the name of Godking Spiff. But instead of listening, they silenced him.Branded a traitor to the Church, Nydid was stripped of his rank and exiled to a distant island, far from Spifftopia. Though the exile was presented as an act of mercy, it was clear to Nydid that it was meant to be his end. Banished from the only life he had known, he was left with nothing but his skills and his faithâ€”though even that was shaken.The island was a harsh and desolate place, inhabited only by a few fellow exiles. Despite the isolation, Nydid found a sense of peace in the simplicity of his new life. He no longer had to navigate the treacherous politics of Spifftopia, and for the first time in years, he was free to live without fear of betrayal.Nydid did not take on any formal roles in the small exile community. Instead, he helped wherever he could, offering his strength and skills as needed. Often, he would join expeditions into the wild, venturing into untamed lands in search of resources.Mining for the town became one of his primary contributions. He spent hours in the dark caverns beneath the island, searching for precious minerals and materials that could help the community survive. Though the work was grueling, it gave him a sense of purpose and helped him distance himself from the political scheming of his past.But Nydidâ€™s greatest contribution came not from the forge or the fields, but from the kitchen. Drawing on the skills he had honed during the Spifftopian Famines, Nydid began cooking for the community. What started as simple meals soon became a source of pride for him.He set up a small stew shop in the inner ward, where he provided nourishing meals to the townsfolk. As he stirred the bubbling pots, Nydid found a new sense of purposeâ€”not in battle or in service to a corrupt institution, but in the simple act of feeding those in need.Title Hi Hello Welcome Bye o7 Infobox Heading Test hidden info

misc/tutorial-note.html.title: Tutorial Note
misc/tutorial-note.html.description:
Headings Create Headings using #: # Heading 1 ## Heading 2 ### Heading 3 Text Formating Bold: **text** Italics: *text* Strikethrough: ~~text~~ Bold and Italic: **Bold and _Italic_** Links Internal: [[Note Name]] External: [Link](URL) Image: ![Alt Text](URL) Lists Unordered: - Item Ordered: 1. Item Tasks: - [ ] Incomplete - [x] Complete Icons You can add icons by using the :icon_name: shortcode. - :Vanilla_absorption:
- :Vanilla_minecraft_campfire: Centered - Using the #t-centered tag Wide - Using the #t-wide tag Top Aligned - Using the #t-top tag Middle Aligned Bottom Aligned

npcs/alenfar.html.title: Alenfar
npcs/alenfar.html.description:
Home | NPC List
Infobox Unknown Deceased Alenfar is an NPC aligned with the Amidonian TemplarsIn short, they are a Templar LeaderHigh Templar on the Dark Isles, Alenfar oversees a wide ranging extraction operation on the Dark Isles, which has included the import of many convict labourers, including many colonists. This has made him unpopular with the Spifftopians, although his relationship with our town remains on generally amicable terms.

npcs/gutankrt.html.title: Gutankrt
npcs/gutankrt.html.description:
Home | NPC List
Infobox Unknown ðŸŸ© Alive Gutankrt is an NPC aligned with the Amidonian InquisitionIn short, they are a Grand InquisitorOne of two Grand inqusitors on the Dark Isles, Gutankrt is supernaturally strong. Generally considered offputting by the colonists, they nevertheless appear to have assisted the colony by using a considerable number of lapis blocks to seal the entrance to falandar proper. Resides in the inquisition's snowy outpost, where they delight in torture and stabbing visitors with a weird stick

npcs/helen.html.title: Helen
npcs/helen.html.description:
Home | NPC List
Infobox Unknown Unknown Helen is an NPC aligned with the Castle StaffIn short, they are a MaidSubject to "Amidonian Conditioning", Helen has effectively had her free will stripped and will follow orders unquestioningly. She was bought from the Merchants by Carl, and was subsequently gifted to the Governor. How she arrived on the Isles as a slave is unknown.

npcs/jason-the-mason.html.title: Jason the Mason
npcs/jason-the-mason.html.description:
Home | NPC List
Infobox Masonry ðŸŸ© Alive Jason the Mason is an NPC aligned with the JasonryIn short, they are a Mason Jason Jasonson, son of Jason Jasonson, grew up in the slums of Spifftopia, where he decided, like his father, and his father before him, and his father aswell, to become a Masonman. One day, when Jason returned back to his father's Masonry Workshop, he realized that his brother, Dason Jasonson, had done a Masonry coup against his father, and due to the power this granted him, had decided to banish Jason Jasonson from Spifftopia, and sent him with the next colony ship to the Dark Isles. Now, on the Dark Isles, Jason Jasonson has setup his own Masonry Workshop, the Jasonry, where he secretly plots his revenge upon his brother.

npcs/seastik.html.title: Seastik
npcs/seastik.html.description:
Home | NPC List
Infobox Unknown ðŸŸ© Alive Seastik is an NPC aligned with the AlcoholIn short, they are a DrunkardEx pirate captain who has racked up massive debts to unreputable lenders. He is best known for his drinking problems, his hatred of anyone who gets inbetween him and destroying his liver further, taking the first set of player characters to the island, and drinking. Dislikes authority, especially the Governor, who evicted him from his original shack

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_minCollapseDepth.description: Only allow outline items to be collapsed if they are at least this many levels deep in the tree.

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_siteName.description: The name of the vault / exported site

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site

bodyClasses: publish css-settings-manager show-inline-title show-ribbon callout-block img-adj-list is-focused
